column5: Nice score!
Yeah I spose

That would be cool, Brian - thanks.  The finder base screws onto the lexan plate. use two of those 1" quick release straps. attaches right on the tube. I couldnt find a pic with it on my tube, but you get the idea Dutch.

That looks awesome!  Do you hook the 'ducer to the bottom of the straps? I also have an ice 'ducer, I'll play around and see what works.  That's the one thing that sucks about buying toys out of season, you can't play with them. Well I suppose I could but that would be dang cold....

That looks awesome!  Do you hook the 'ducer to the bottom of the straps? I also have an ice 'ducer, I'll play around and see what works.  That's the one thing that sucks about buying toys out of season, you can't play with them. Well I suppose I could but that would be dang cold....  I had the ice ducer then. Just hang it off the side.  Waters not that cold yet. Hell, we floated out on simcoe after ice out. Now that was cold.
frig i wish i coulda found one...perfect for fly fishing rivers ughhh
Hell no, next time I'm on water it will be frozen! You could probably tempt me in spring though. Can I wear my survival suit on that thing??
I don't fly fish but I will be hitting some rivers nonetheless.
to further add to the deals, the fam just grabbed an 8 inch jiffy 4 stroke auger for the cottage for 316.  not too shabby at all canadian tire, not too shabby.
Good stuff! I used a manual auger once. Once. Then ice went and got my gas auger. Never go back....
That is a score. I'm wondering if there's any left around here now?  Just to have a second one at that price would be mint!

That is a score. I'm wondering if there's any left around here now?  Just to have a second one at that price would be mint!  As far as I could see there was only one in stock in all of toronto....im just praying it wasnt a system glitch! I paid for it online and am going to pick it up this evening, we shall see if its the real deal!
There's an Eskimo Shark in Richmond Hill that's marked down from 599 to 389  Same one in Maple (AISLE w/o), 299$  There's still a few deals to be had
Good stuff! I used a manual auger once. Once. Then ice went and got my gas auger. Never go back.... Wimp!!!
Good stuff! I used a manual auger once. Once. Then ice went and got my gas auger. Never go back....  I have been using a manul auger the last 3 years. No problem at all.

If anyone wants a Jiffy, they have one in stock online at the Fergus store.  3hp STX for $265 or something like that. I am auger rich or I would've jumped on it.  If someone is set on having it, but coming from a long way, I'll store it until you can pick up.
in today's mail I got a 4 day flyer and they have the Rapala 8" 33cc Cyclone on sale for $349 (reg $549)
St.Catharines had Honda engine strike kings I think it was for 279, 8" 35cc if my memory is working
I have been using a manul auger the last 3 years. No problem at all.  you must have your spots dialed lol  20 holes a day would be pretty tough

I guess that depends what you consider tough. I have been using a hand auger for 30 years. I'm usually set up and fishing before my buddies with gas augers. I have a jiffy as well, but I only use it when the ice is over 15 or so inches, or if I'm with a big group and have the only auger. Drilling 20 holes with a good hand auger is no big deal, really. And I don't use a drill adapter like some guys do...lol. Its not uncommon for me to go perching and drill well over 30 holes with my fin bor 3 to find them. No big deal.  S.

I guess that depends what you consider tough. I have been using a hand auger for 30 years. I'm usually set up and fishing before my buddies with gas augers. I have a jiffy as well, but I only use it when the ice is over 15 or so inches, or if I'm with a big group and have the only auger. Drilling 20 holes with a good hand auger is no big deal, really. And I don't use a drill adapter like some guys do...lol. Its not uncommon for me to go perching and drill well over 30 holes with my fin bor 3 to find them. No big deal.  S.  I said it was a manual,didnt say how it got turned.LOL  And yes, I am dialed in on my spots AK.

Came across a deal I couldn't refuse today;    I don't know if float tubing is for me but for $70 I'm willing to find out!  Here she is at home:    I'm excited to try it out next spring.  Canadian Tire now has their in store clearance inventory online. I also got 50% off a new bbq today!  I had to go to two stores but well worth it.  Happy shopping! (Hint: check a few local stores, each store has different pricing).

Well let me be the first to say, you SCORED.  This was my first float boat. I loved it.  You will need a set of flippers now.  Then comes the mods to add a finder.  Then comes the, this is good, but now I want something bigger.  Then you are now into a toon.  More mods to be had.  Enjoy Dutch.
I can see it already - I saved on the float but I'll spend it all back and more on mods/upgrades.  Hmmmm....I've already got a portable finder...... and so it begins!
Sweet find! I've been tempted to grab one of those and have carp take me for a tow at the cottage
HOLYâ€¦.SCORRRRRRE! That's awesome, wanted to take one of those to Antigua and leave it at my brother in laws for exploring every winter. ENJOY!
and that's how I went home with a Pflueger Patriarch when I went in to get my daughter a new Fenwick HMX
Score? Ya think? The air to fill it costs 70 bucks. Happy treading.

I almost forgot, on Friday I also got a 28" Abu Garcia Veritas 2.0 ML ice rod & reel combo for $24 at CTC. I already have one and like it. That's what got me poking around on their site for clearance items in the first place.

I almost forgot, on Friday I also got a 28" Abu Garcia Veritas 2.0 ML ice rod & reel combo for $24 at CTC. I already have one and like it. That's what got me poking around on their site for clearance items in the first place. You didn't see my post telling people to hunt the clearance section of the site?  I got my reel, rod and a spool of line for $200 and the bill said I saved $200!
Smoking deal  Good for you
sonar's and allmost all summer fishing items are being cleared out so they don't have to 'pay to hold them'

Buddy and I bought 2 helix 5 sonar/GPS for $234 plus tax each.  Will make a nice upgrade to the 385 I use for ice fishing.  Almost had a 55lb thrust Minn Kota I pilot unit for $550 plus tax.  Was going to buy as a backup, I just couldn't resist the price.  The order went through but they cancelled it after spending 40 minutes searching for the unit.  Spoke to them on the phone and they stated it appeared to be ghost inventory, too bad, that would've been the deal of the century.  I did also get a new float coat for $100.

. Almost had a 55lb thrust Minn Kota I pilot unit for $550 plus tax. Was going to buy as a backup, I just couldn't resist the price. The order went through but they cancelled it after spending 40 minutes searching for the unit. Spoke to them on the phone and they stated it appeared to be ghost inventory, too bad, that would've been the deal of the century. I did also get a new float coat for $100. Lindsay store shows one in stock
in fact they show 3 units avail.
There's only 2 left now.  Act fast on a screaming deal.  I was tempted to be a jerk and buy all 3 and resell, but there are only so many hours in the day lol.  Thanks for the tip!

There's only 2 left now. Act fast on a screaming deal. I was tempted to be a jerk and buy all 3 and resell, but there are only so many hours in the day lol. Thanks for the tip! Did you need me to pick one up for you for did you get one?

That's a steal right there.  Both items I bought today were not out on the shelves. The BBQ was put away "upstairs", thank you to the kids who spent 20 minutes finding it for me.  The float tube was actually at the bottom of a shrink wrapped skid being wheeled into the back. I hollered at the kids to stop. He said he just built the skid and wrapped it, I told him "looks like you'll be doing it twice".
I have my  finder holder that I made Dutch. Rotates 180 deg. No use to me now. Yours if you want it. Just straps on with a 1" quick strap.
You don't have to wait till spring take it tubing down the hill. Nice tube at a great price.   Art
Thank you for the offer.  I bought it online and they will confirm the order once they find it (usually get an email next day). If I can't make it out in a timely fashion I'll let you know!

Thank you for the offer. I bought it online and they will confirm the order once they find it (usually get an email next day). If I can't make it out in a timely fashion I'll let you know! Let me know.  I have to head to the Whitby area to pick up the kids on Friday after work
That would be cool, Brian - thanks.

Doh!!!! I was just there???? Ughhh  I got the wife a winter jacket retail $179 on sale for $49. And new work bibs, reg. $179 on sale for $74  I shoulda looked around more, woulda bought this in a heartbeat
But each store is different Rick for deals.  It's all based on clearing out stock to not have to wrap it up for 6 months or so
